questions.question: Do you identify and fix system flaws promptly?
questions.context: Installing patches and updates when they're released.
questions.examples: Windows Updates, Patch Tuesday, update policy
questions.followUp: How often are updates installed? Who manages this?
questions.discussion: Organizations identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner. This includes installing security-relevant software and firmware updates.

questions.question: Do you have antivirus/anti-malware protection?
questions.context: Basic protection against viruses and malicious software.
questions.examples: Windows Defender, commercial antivirus, endpoint protection
questions.followUp: What antivirus do you use? On all computers?
questions.discussion: Malicious code protection mechanisms include antivirus software and intrusion detection/prevention systems. These must be installed and operating.
assessmentObjectives: Anti-malware is deployed on all systems

questions.question: Do you update antivirus definitions regularly?
questions.context: Antivirus needs current threat information to be effective.
questions.followUp: Are updates automatic? How do you verify they're current?
questions.discussion: Malicious code protection mechanisms must be updated whenever new releases are available. This includes signature/definition files and the scanning engine itself.

questions.question: Do you perform periodic system scans?
questions.context: Regular scans catch what real-time protection might miss.
questions.examples: Weekly full scans, scheduled scans, scan reports
questions.followUp: How often do scans run? Who reviews results?
questions.discussion: Periodic scans of organizational systems and real-time scans of files from external sources help ensure malicious code is detected and addressed.
